title._content: ["Lyndhurst," Finley Johnson Shepard house, 635 South Broadway, Tarrytown, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Lyndhurst," Finley Johnson Shepard house, 635 South Broadway, Tarrytown, New York. Spring bloom] [ca. 1914] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Alexander Jackson Davis, from 1838. Associated Name: Helen Gould (Mrs. Finley J.) Shephard was the daughter of railroad magnate Jay Gould (1836-1892) who acquired the property in 1880. Today: National Trust for Historic Presevation house with restored gardens on 67 acres. On slide (handwritten): "S" and "Shepard" [sic]. Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Photo includes magnolia. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Subjects: Gardens--New York (State)--Tarrytown--1910-1920. Flowers--New York (State)--Tarrytown--1910-1920. Format: Lantern slides--Hand-colored--1910-1900. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16229 Call Number: LC-J717-X100- 20
